Description[edit | edit source]

The Su-6 (M-71F) is a rank IV Soviet strike aircraft with a battle rating of 4.7 (AB/RB) and 5.3 (SB). It was introduced in Update 1.63 "Desert Hunters".

Survivability and armour[edit | edit source]

Crew2 people
Speed of destruction
Structural680 km/h
Gear330 km/h
  • 4 mm steel on both sides of the nose
  • 4 mm steel on both sides of gunner
  • 6 mm steel in propeller spinner
  • 6 mm steel surrounding wing-mounted oil cooling systems
  • 6 mm steel on top of pilot
  • 6 mm steel on both sides of pilot
  • 6 mm steel in front of and below windshield
  • 6 mm steel at an angle in front of gunner*
  • 10 mm steel behind gunner
  • 10-12 mm steel in front of gunner*
  • 64 mm bulletproof glass in front of pilot
  • 64 mm bulletproof glass in front of gunner*
  • Self-sealing fuel tanks, with neutral gas pressurization system (1 under pilot)

Armaments[edit | edit source]

Offensive armament[edit | edit source]

Weapon 12 x 37 mm NS-37 cannon
Ammunition90 rounds
Fire rate260 shots/min
Weapon 22 x 7.62 mm ShKAS machine gun
Ammunition1 500 rounds
Fire rate1 800 shots/min
Main articles: NS-37 (37 mm), ShKAS (7.62 mm)

The Su-6 (M-71F) is armed with:

  • 2 x 37 mm NS-37 cannons, wing-mounted (45 rpg = 90 total)
  • 2 x 7.62 mm ShKAS machine guns, wing-mounted (750 rpg = 1,500 total)

Suspended armament[edit | edit source]

List of setups (10)
Setup 116 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bomb
Setup 26 x 50 kg FAB-50sv (forged) bomb
Setup 32 x 100 kg FAB-100sv (forged) bomb
4 x 100 kg FAB-100sv bomb
Setup 42 x 250 kg FAB-250sv bomb
Setup 56 x 50 kg FAB-50sv (forged) bomb
10 x M-8 rockets
Setup 66 x 50 kg FAB-50sv (forged) bomb
10 x RBS-82 rockets
Setup 716 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bomb
10 x M-8 rockets
Setup 816 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bomb
10 x RBS-82 rockets
Setup 910 x M-13UK rockets
Setup 1010 x RBS-132 rockets
Main articles: AO-25M-1 (25 kg), FAB-50sv (50 kg), FAB-100sv (100 kg), FAB-250sv (250 kg)
Main articles: M-8, M-13UK, RBS-82, RBS-132

The Su-6 (M-71F) can be outfitted with the following ordnance:

  • Without load
  • 16 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bombs (400 kg total)
  • 6 x 50 kg FAB-50sv bombs (300 kg total)
  • 6 x 100 kg FAB-100sv bombs (600 kg total)
  • 2 x 250 kg FAB-250sv bombs (500 kg total)
  • 6 x 50 kg FAB-50sv bombs + 10 x M-8 rockets (300 kg total)
  • 6 x 50 kg FAB-50sv bombs + 10 x RBS-82 rockets (300 kg total)
  • 16 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bombs + 10 x M-8 rockets (400 kg total)
  • 16 x 25 kg AO-25M-1 bombs + 10 x RBS-82 rockets (400 kg total)
  • 10 x M-13UK rockets
  • 10 x RBS-132 rockets

Defensive armament[edit | edit source]

Turret12.7 mm Berezin UB machine gun
Ammunition196 rounds
Fire rate1027 shots/min
Main article: Berezin UB (12.7 mm)

The Su-6 (M-71F) is defended by:

  • 1 x 12.7 mm Berezin UB machine gun, dorsal turret (196 rpg)

If necessary, note the specifics of the game in different modes (AB, RB, SB).

Pros and cons[edit | edit source]

Pros:

  • Powerful 37 mm cannons
  • Reasonably well-armoured
  • Good ordnance options
  • High ammo count
  • Only 1 fuel tank, making it hard to hit

Cons:

  • Bad manoeuvrability
  • Slow
  • Defensive MG firing arc is heavily restricted

History[edit | edit source]

Describe the history of the creation and combat usage of the aircraft in more detail than in the introduction. If the historical reference turns out to be too long, take it to a separate article, taking a link to the article about the vehicle and adding a block "/History" (example: https://wiki.warthunder.com/(Vehicle-name)/History) and add a link to it here using the main template. Be sure to reference text and sources by using <ref></ref>, as well as adding them at the end of the article with <references />. This section may also include the vehicle's dev blog entry (if applicable) and the in-game encyclopedia description (under === In-game description ===, also if applicable).
